title: Top Places to visit in South West Garo Hills, Ampati, Meghalaya
content: South West Garo Hills is an administrative district in the State of Meghalaya, India. The Ampati Civil Sub-Division is upgraded to a full fledged district as South West Garo Hills, on 7 August 2012 with its headquarters at Ampati. content:

title: Top Places to visit in West Jaintia Hills, Jowai, Meghalaya
content: West Jaintia Hills is an administrative District in the state of Meghalaya in India. The united district (Jaintia Hills District) was created on 22 February 1972 and occupied an area of 3819 km2. It had a population of 295,692 (as of 2001). title: Top Places to visit in West Garo Hills, Tura, Meghalaya
content: West Garo Hills is an administrative district in Garo Hills of the state of Meghalaya in India. Tura town is the administrative headquarters of the district. title: Top Places to visit in Aizawl, Mizoram
content: Aizawl is the capital of the state of Mizoram in India. With a population of 293,416, it is the largest city in the state. title: Top Places to visit in Champhai, Mizoram
content: Champhai is a border town in Mizoram state, in far eastern India. It is the headquarters of Champhai district, one of the eight districts in the state. It is located on the Indo-Myanmar border and is situated in a strategically important location. Because of this, it is the main business corridor

content:
Kolasib is a district as well as a district headquarters of Kolasib district in Mizoram, India.
Kolasib district is one of the eight districts of Mizoram state in India. It is the smallest district in Mizoram with an area of 1,386 km2(535 sq mi).

title: Top Places to visit in Lunglei, Mizoram
content: Lunglei is a town, situated in the south-central part of Mizoram state, northeastern India. Lunglei, sometimes spelled Lungleh, literally meaning 'bridge of rock' got its name from a bridge like rock found in the riverine area around Nghasih - a small tributary of the river Tlawng. title: Top Places to visit in Mamit, Mizoram
content:
Mamit is a census town in Mamit district in the Indian state of Mizoram. Mamit emerged from the regrouping of villages.
Mamit district is one of the eight districts of Mizoram state in India.
